intro: Daphnopsis morii, commonly known as the mountain daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with a distinctive tubular shape, and are borne in clusters. Daphnopsis morii is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky slopes.
